clustersettings module¶

This in itself is a non-functional module. It only stores environment variables.

Bases: exceptions.BaseException

class groerrors.GromacsMessages(gro_err='', command='', *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Load an error message and split it along as many properties as posible

check()[source]¶

Check if the GROMACS error message have any of the known error messages. Set the self.error to the value of the error

e = {'Can not open file': <class 'groerrors.IOGromacsError'>, 'File input/output error': <class 'groerrors.IOGromacsError'>, 'srun: error: Unable to create job step': <class 'groerrors.IOGromacsError'>}¶
exception groerrors.IOGromacsError(command, explain)[source]¶

Bases: groerrors.GromacsError

class gromacs.Gromacs(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

count_lipids(**kwargs)[source]¶

count_lipids: Counts the lipids in source and writes a target with N4 tags

get_charge(**kwargs)[source]¶

get_charge: Gets the total charge of a system using gromacs grompp command

get_membrane_complex()[source]¶
get_ndx_groups(**kwargs)[source]¶

get_ndx_groups: Run make_ndx and set the total number of groups found

get_ndx_sol(**kwargs)[source]¶

get_ndx_sol: Run make_ndx and set the last number id for SOL found

make_ndx(**kwargs)[source]¶

make_ndx: Wraps the make_ndx command tweaking the input to reflect the characteristics of the complex

make_topol_lipids(**kwargs)[source]¶

make_topol_lipids: Add lipid positions to topol.top

manual_log(command, output)[source]¶

manual_log: Redirect the output to file in command[“options”][“log”]

passing: Do nothing, to respect some orders

run_recipe: Run recipe for the complex

select_recipe: Select the appropriate recipe for the complex

set_box_sizes()[source]¶

set_box_sizes: Set length values for different boxes

set_chains: Set the REAL points of a dimer after protonation

set_grompp(**kwargs)[source]¶

set_grompp: Copy template files to working dir

set_itp(**kwargs)[source]¶

set_itp: Cut a top file to be usable later as itp

set_membrane_complex(value)[source]¶

set_membrane_complex: Sets the monomer object

set_options(options, breaks)[source]¶

set_options: Set break options from recipe

set_popc(tgt='')[source]¶

set_popc: Create a pdb file only with the lipid bilayer (POP), no waters. Set some measures on the fly (height of the bilayer)

set_protein_size(**kwargs)[source]¶

set_protein_size: Get the protein maximum base width from a pdb file

set_stage_init(**kwargs)[source]¶

set_stage_init: Copy a set of files from source to target dir

set_steep(**kwargs)[source]¶

set_steep: Copy the template steep.mdp to target dir

set_water(**kwargs)[source]¶

set_water: Create a water layer for a box

Bases: protein.Compound

check_forces()[source]¶

A force field must give a set of forces that matches every atom in the pdb file. This showed particularly important to the ligands, as they may vary along a very broad range of atoms

class protein.Monomer(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

delete_chain()[source]¶

PDBs which have a chain column mess up with pdb2gmx, creating an unsuitable protein.itp file by naming the protein ie “Protein_A”. Here we remove the chain value

According to http://www.wwpdb.org/documentation/format33/sect9.html, the chain value is in column 22

utils module¶

utils.check_forces(pdb, itp, ffield)[source]¶

A force field must give a set of forces that matches every atom in the pdb file. This showed particularly important to the ligands, as they may vary along a very broad range of atoms.

utils.clean_all(target_dir='', exclude=[])[source]¶
Remove all intermediate files from ‘target_dir’ except that files
in ‘exclude’
utils.clean_topol(src=[], tgt=[])[source]¶

Clean the src topol of path specifics, and paste results in target

utils.concat(**kwargs)[source]¶

Make a whole pdb file with all the pdb provided

utils.getbw(**kwargs)[source]¶

Call the Ballesteros-Weistein based pair-distance restraint module.

utils.make_cat(dir1, dir2, name)[source]¶

Very tight function to make a list of files to inject in some GROMACS suite programs

utils.make_ffoplsaanb(complex=None)[source]¶

Join all OPLS force fields needed to run the simulation

utils.make_topol(template_dir='/Users/esguerra/software/pymemdyn/templates', target_dir='', working_dir='', complex=None)[source]¶

Make the topol starting from our topol.top template

utils.make_topol_lines(itp_name='', ifdef_name='', posre_name='')[source]¶

Make the topol lines to be included

utils.tar_out(src_dir=[], tgt=[])[source]¶

Tar everything in a src_dir to the tar_file

utils.tune_mdp(groups)[source]¶

Adjust the tc-groups of eq.mdp to be in line with our system
